item.title: Config GitHub
item.description: Create OAuth Application covergates-server uses OAuth2 to control user access. To create an OAuth2 application on GitHub, please refer to Creating an OAuth App for detail. Notice that the Authorization callback URL should be https://your.domain.name/login/github. Here is an example: You should get the Client ID and Client Secret on your application setting page. Update Environment Once you create an OAuth application on GitHub, you could use below environment variables to tell covergates-server to use it.

item.title: Config Gitea
item.description: Create OAuth Application covergates-server uses OAuth2 to control user access. To create an OAuth2 application on Gitea, navigate Settings > Applications on your Gitea website. The URL would be: # Replace http://localhost:3000 to your Gitea URL http://localhost:3000/user/settings/applications Create a new application as shown below: Replace http://localhost:8080/login/gitea to your Covergates URL, such as http://your.domain.name/login/gitea You should get your Client ID and Client Secret like: Update Environment Once you create an OAuth application on Gitea, you could use below environment variables to tell covergates-server to use it.

item.title: Quick Start
item.description: This tutorial will access to https://covergates.com. If you are using self-hosted version, please replace https://covergates.com/ to your self-hosted server URL. Fundamental Workflow Sign up Covergates with your GitHub or Gitea account. Navigate https://covergates.com/repo to the list of your repositories. Click ACTIVATE button to activate the repository for uploading coverage reports. Go to SETTING tag, you can update report path filter and get your Report ID

item.title: Command Line Tool
item.description: The Command You can acquire covergates command line tool for releases page. Download the .tar.gz for your platform and extract it to somewhere in your PATH. You test it by running: Copy covergates help NAME: covergate - A new cli application USAGE: covergates [global options] command [command options] [arguments...] VERSION: 0.0 COMMANDS: upload upload coverage report comment leave a report summary comment help, h Shows a list of commands or help for one command GLOBAL OPTIONS: --url value api service url (default: "https://covergates.

item.title: Repository Setting
item.description: You could config repository on setting page. Filter Path Filter takes regular expressions and trims the path.
